required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cord Blood Transfusion In Preterm Neonates (CB-TrIP)
clinical_study.official_title: Fetal Hemoglobin Levels and Umbilical Cord or Adult Blood RBC Transfusions in Preterm Neonates.

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: Repeated transfusions have been associated with very poor outcome of preterm infants. Fetal hemoglobin (HbF) and adult Hb (HbA) have different affinity for oxygen. The high level of adult Hb may contribute to exacerbating the oxidative damage responsible for prematurity diseases. The investigators hypothesized that transfusing red blood cells (RBC) obtained from allogeneic cord blood (CB) of healthy full-term babies (which contains almost exclusively HbF) may prevent the non-physiological decrease of HbF in premature neonates, likewise protecting them from oxygen radical diseases. Cord blood transfusion in preterms - CB TRIP - is a monocentric prospective nonrandomized study aimed to monitor HbF levels in preterm neonates receiving RBC transfusions from either umbilical blood of full-term healthy babies (CB-RBC) and/or from adult donors (A-RBC).

detailed_description.textblock: Preterm neonates enrolled in this study are monitored for the level of HbF on capillary blood samples, from birth to the week 32 of postmenstrual age (PMA). To fulfill the RBC transfusion requirements, RBC concentrates obtained from umbilical blood of full-term healthy babies are utilized, if available; otherwise, RBC concentrates from adult donors are assigned. For every week of PMA, neonates undergo a minimum of three HbF determinations, and the median values are considered.

primary_outcome.measure: Median Percentage of HbF at 32 Weeks of Post Menstrual Age
primary_outcome.time_frame: From study entry to the completion of postmenstrual age of 32 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The HbF level was determined by high-performance liquid chromatography and was expressed as percentage of total Hb, calculated as the sum of fetal and adult Hb, according to the formula: HbF= [HbF/ (FHbA1 + HbA2 + HbF)]. HbF.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to last HbF assessment occurring at 36 weeks, discharge or death
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline of Htc observed after either adult-RBC or cord-RBC transfusions. To this purpose, analysis was carried out between the two groups of RBC transfusions and patients were accordingly redistributed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to the last HbF assessment occurring at 36 weeks, discharge or death
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days between two consecutive transfusions.To this purpose, analysis was carried out between the two groups of RBC transfusions and patients were accordingly redistributed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Percentage of HbF at Last Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to the last HbF assessment occurring at 36 weeks, discharge or death
secondary_outcome.description: Median percentage of HbF at last HbF assessment. The last HbF measure was obtained at the completion of the 36 week of age, discharge or death.

biospec_descr.textblock: 80-100 microL of capillary blood for HbF assessment

study_pop.textblock: The CB TRIP trial enrolls preterm neonates born before the 30th week of gestation and/or neonates with birth weight <1000 grams, admitted to the NICU of Policlinico Gemelli, and candidate to receive one or more RBC transfusions. These characteristics (birth <28 weeks of gestation and birth weight <1000 grams) identify a very fragile population, with significant early mortality and morbidity and high risk for lifelong invalidating consequences.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
preterm neonates born at PMA ≤30 weeks and/or with birth weight ≤1000 g born at the delivery room of Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli candidate to receive one or more RBC unit transfusion.
Exclusion Criteria:
One or more of the following criteria Maternal-fetal immunization Hydrops fetalis Major congenital malformations associated or not with genetic syndromes Previous transfusions Hemorrhage at birth Congenital infections (such as infections from TORCH complex) Out-born infants The health care team deems it inappropriate to approach the infant's family for informed consent

facility.name: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli IRCCS

reference.citation: Bianchi M, Papacci P, Valentini CG, Barbagallo O, Vento G, Teofili L. Umbilical cord blood as a source for red-blood-cell transfusion in neonatology: a systematic review. Vox Sang. 2018 Nov;113(8):713-725. doi: 10.1111/vox.12720. Epub 2018 Oct 16.

Bianchi M, Giannantonio C, Spartano S, Fioretti M, Landini A, Molisso A, Tesfagabir GM, Tornesello A, Barbagallo O, Valentini CG, Vento G, Zini G, Romagnoli C, Papacci P, Teofili L. Allogeneic umbilical cord blood red cell concentrates: an innovative blood product for transfusion therapy of preterm infants. Neonatology. 2015;107(2):81-6. doi: 10.1159/000368296. Epub 2014 Nov 15.

Stutchfield CJ, Jain A, Odd D, Williams C, Markham R. Foetal haemoglobin, blood transfusion, and retinopathy of prematurity in very preterm infants: a pilot prospective cohort study. Eye (Lond). 2017 Oct;31(10):1451-1455. doi: 10.1038/eye.2017.76. Epub 2017 May 26.

dos Santos AM, Guinsburg R, de Almeida MF, Procianoy RS, Leone CR, Marba ST, Rugolo LM, Fiori HH, Lopes JM, Martinez FE; Brazilian Network on Neonatal Research. Red blood cell transfusions are independently associated with intra-hospital mortality in very low birth weight preterm infants. J Pediatr. 2011 Sep;159(3):371-376.e1-3. doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2011.02.040. Epub 2011 Apr 13.

Valieva OA, Strandjord TP, Mayock DE, Juul SE. Effects of transfusions in extremely low birth weight infants: a retrospective study. J Pediatr. 2009 Sep;155(3):331-37.e1. doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2009.02.026.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
responsible_party.investigator_title: Medical Director of the UNICATT Cord Blood Bank

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Parents of neonates with birth weight < 1000 gr and/or postmenstrual age < 30 weeks consecutively admitted to the intensive neonatal unit of Fondazione Poiliclinico Gemelli IRCCS were informed about the study and asked to paricipate.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Among 29 couples, 25 accepted to participate and overall 25 patients were enrolled.

group.title: Non Transfused
group.description: Patient not receiving transfusions

group.title: Cord-RBC Transfusions
group.description: Patients receiving exclusively allogeneic top up transfusions obtained from healthy full term neonates.

group.title: Adult-RBC Transfusion
group.description: Patients receiving exclusively standard RBC transfusions from adult donors

group.title: Cord- and Adult-RBC Transfusions
group.description: Patients receiving both types of transfusions

period.title: From Enrollment to the Age of 32 Weeks

participants_list.participants: Patients receiving no transfusions before the age of 32 weeks
Patients receiving only cord-RBC transfusions before the age of 32 weeks
Patients receiving only adult-RBC transfusions before the age of 32 weeks
Patients receiving both adult-RBC and cord-RBCs before the age of 32 weeks

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Death before the age of 32 weeks

period.title: From Enrollment to the Last HbF Test

participants_list.participants: Patients receiving no transfusions before last HbF test (occurring at 36 weeks,discharge or death)
Patients receiving only cord-RBCs before last HbF test (occurring at 36 wks,discharge or death)
Patients receiving only adult-RBC before last HbF test (occurring at 36 wks,discharge or death)
Patients receiving both cord and adult-RBCs before the last HbFtest(age of 36 wk,discharge or death)

baseline.population: These data refer to all patients enrolled in the study, grouped according types of transfusions received (if any) until the completion of the age of 36 weeks, discharge or death.

group.title: Non-Transfused
group.description: 13 patients not receiving transfusions.

group.title: Only Cord-RBC
group.description: 3 patients receiving exclusively cord-RBC transfusions

group.title: Only Adult-RBC
group.description: 4 patients receiving exclusively adult-RBC transfusions

group.title: Cord- and Adult-RBC
group.description: 5 patients receiving both adult-RBC and cord-RBC transfusions

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Median Percentage of HbF at 32 Weeks of Post Menstrual Age
outcome.description: The HbF level was determined by high-performance liquid chromatography and was expressed as percentage of total Hb, calculated as the sum of fetal and adult Hb, according to the formula: HbF= [HbF/ (FHbA1 + HbA2 + HbF)]. HbF.
outcome.time_frame: From study entry to the completion of postmenstrual age of 32 weeks
outcome.population: The overall amount of 264 HbF results were included in the analysis. HbF was expressed as percentage of total Hb (i.e. HbF+HbA1+HbA2)

group.title: Non-transfused
group.description: 127 HbF measures obtained from 13 preterm neonates surviving until the completion of postmenstrual age of 32 weeks without receiving transfusions

group.title: Only Cord-RBC
group.description: 19 HbF measures obtained from 2 preterm neonates surviving until the completion of postmenstrual age of 32 weeks,receiving only cord-RBC transfusions

group.title: Only adult_RBC
group.description: 33 HbF measures obtained from 3 preterm neonates surviving until the completion of postmenstrual age of 32 weeks,receiving only adult-RBC transfusions

group.title: Both Cord-RBC and adult_RBC
group.description: 85 HbF measures obtained from 5 preterm neonates surviving until the completion of postmenstrual age of 32 weeks,receiving both cord-RBC and adult-RBC transfusions

measure.title: Median Percentage of HbF at 32 Weeks of Post Menstrual Age
measure.description: The HbF level was determined by high-performance liquid chromatography and was expressed as percentage of total Hb, calculated as the sum of fetal and adult Hb, according to the formula: HbF= [HbF/ (FHbA1 + HbA2 + HbF)]. HbF.
measure.population: The overall amount of 264 HbF results were included in the analysis. HbF was expressed as percentage of total Hb (i.e. HbF+HbA1+HbA2)

analysis.groups_desc: Group comparison is carried out among HbF values grouped according to the transfusion regimen (only cord blood transfusions, only adult transfusions, both cord and adult transfusions).

outcome.title: Post-transfusion Hematocrit (Htc) Change
outcome.description: Change from baseline of Htc observed after either adult-RBC or cord-RBC transfusions. To this purpose, analysis was carried out between the two groups of RBC transfusions and patients were accordingly redistributed.
outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to last HbF assessment occurring at 36 weeks, discharge or death
outcome.population: Eight patients received 13 cord-RBC units and 9 patients received 18 adult-RBC units. Change of hematocrit value after each transfusion was recorded.

group.title: Cord-RBC Transfusions
group.description: top up transfusions obtained from cord blood of healthy full term neonates.

group.title: Adult-RBC Transfusions
group.description: top up transfusions obtained from adult blood donors

measure.title: Post-transfusion Hematocrit (Htc) Change
measure.description: Change from baseline of Htc observed after either adult-RBC or cord-RBC transfusions. To this purpose, analysis was carried out between the two groups of RBC transfusions and patients were accordingly redistributed.
measure.population: Eight patients received 13 cord-RBC units and 9 patients received 18 adult-RBC units. Change of hematocrit value after each transfusion was recorded.

outcome.title: Intervals Between Transfusions
outcome.description: Number of days between two consecutive transfusions.To this purpose, analysis was carried out between the two groups of RBC transfusions and patients were accordingly redistributed.
outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to the last HbF assessment occurring at 36 weeks, discharge or death
outcome.population: Eight patients received a total number of 13 cord-RBC trasfusions and 9 patients received a total number of 18 adult -RBC transfusions. The intervals between two consecutive transfusions was recorded for each type of RBC unit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
